title.narrative: BRAZIL BAHIA SUSTAINABLE RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

description.narrative: To increase market integration, net revenues, and food security of organized beneficiaries; as well as to improve access to water supply and sanitation services of households in Project areas.

participating-org.narrative: Companhia de Desenvolvimento e Acao Regional
Government of the State of Bahia
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Annual Operating Plans | Description :The Borrower shall (a) prepare and furnish to the Bank annual operatingplans, detailing the Project activities to be carried out during the year following the date of presentation of each plan, togetherwith the respective sources of funding, by December 31 of each year; (b) furnish to the Bank the approved annual operating plansnot later than 30 day after the publication of said plan. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :CAR Subsidiary Agreement | Description :The Borrower shall transfer a portion of the proceeds of the Loan to CARunder an agreement (the CAR Subsidiary Agreement) to be entered into between the Borrower and CAR, under terms and conditionsapproved by the Bank ("CAR Subsidiary Agreement") | Due Date :31-Jul-2014

Finance Agreement :Cooperation Agreement | Description :The Cooperation Agreement to be entered into between CAR and theCooperating Entity under terms and conditions acceptable to the Bank within sixty (60) days of the Declaration of Effectiveness,setting forth their respective roles and responsibilities regarding the implementation of the Project, for purposes of assistingCAR in the technical aspects of Project implementation. | Due Date :30-Nov-2014

Finance Agreement :Project Management Unit | Description :The Borrower shall establish, and thereafter maintain until thecompletion of the Project, a Project Management Unit (PMU) within CAR for project implementation with manager, technicians, expertsand necessary staff for project management, coordination, supervision, monitoring and evaluation. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Territorial Units | Description :The Borrower shall operate, and thereafter maintain until thecompletion of the Project, at least eighteen (18) Project TerritorialUnits under CAR for day-to-day Project implementation at thelocal level to ensure coordination and integration between local institutions and stakeholders in all 27 State Territories. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Not later than May 31, 2017 and for purposes of implementing Part 2(c) of the Project enter into an agreement (the CERB Agreement),under terms and conditions acceptable to the Bank, setting forth their respective roles and responsibilities regarding theimplementation of the project.

The Borrower shall establish, and thereafter maintain during the implementation of the Project, a Project Steering Committeechaired by CAR, and composed by representatives from SDR, SIHS, SEMA and CERB, as defined in the Operational Manual, responsiblefor providing general oversight and guidance on the strategic and multisectoral aspects of the Project

The Borrower shall establish, and thereafter maintain during the implementation of the Project, a Project Steering Committeechaired by CAR, and composed by representatives from SEAGRI, SEDUR, SETRE, SEMA, SEDIR and CERB, as defined in the OperationalManual, responsible for providing general oversight and guidance on the strategic and multisectoral aspects of the Project.

title.narrative: Increase in the total number of formal contracts integrating beneficiary Producer Organizations (POs) into markets
Increase in the yearly volume of sales through contracts from beneficiary Producer Organizations (POs) and Community Associations (CAs).
Number of business plans & investment plans implemented by POs and CAs
Basic WSS investments implemented and sustainably operated
New piped household water connections that are resulting from the project intervention
Market-oriented subproject beneficiaries who received training as a result of the Project
Direct jobs generated as a result of the Project's interventions and investments - Component 1
Direct jobs generated as a result of the Project's interventions and investments - Component 2
Clients who adopted an improved agr. technology promoted by project – female
People trained to improve hygiene behavior/sanitation practices under the proj
Number of people benefitting from capacity building on management of water supply and sanitation systems
Direct jobs generated as a result of the Project's interventions and investments - Component 3
Share of vulnerable and marginalized people of the total project beneficiaries under Component 1
Share of Vulnerable and marginalized people of the total project beneficiaries under Component 2
Increase in the real net revenue of beneficiary Rural Producer Organizations (RPOs)
Number of government staff and strategic partners trained in accordance with the Project Capacity Building Plan
Increase in average vulnerable beneficiary household dietary diversity indicator
Producer Organizations (POs) and Community Associations (CAs) implementing financial management instruments in subprojects
Clients who have adopted an improved agr. technology promoted by the project
People provided with access to "improved sanitation facilities” under the proj.
People trained to improve hygiene behavior/sanitation practices - female
Targeted clients satisfied with agricultural services - female
Targeted clients satisfied with agricultural services (percentage)
Targeted clients satisfied with agricultural services - male
